intro: Rourea sympetala, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, yellowish-green inflorescences that resemble mist or clouds. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers surrounded by fleshy, colorful bracts that serve to attract pollinators. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Rourea sympetala thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests or along stream banks.
